frame.name: Certainty
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns a <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s certainty about the correctness of beliefs or expectations. It only includes uses where a <fen>Cognizer</fen> is expressed.
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">Lermontov</fex> <m>was</m> <t>certain</t> <fex name="Content">he would come to the party</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose certainty or uncertainty is at issue.
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">Marcel</fex> <m>was</m> <t>sure</t> that she had seen Eldridge on the balcony.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a certain/uncertain belief about.
<ex>She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he <m>was</m> <t>unsure</t> <fex name="Topic">of her conviction</fex>.</ex> <ex>I '<m>m</m> <t>dubious</t> <fex name="Topic">about this Mafia story</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
<ex>I <m>am</m> <t>sure</t> <fex name="Content">that we'll arrive on time</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain.
<ex>Charles felt <fex name="Degr">fairly</fex> <t>confident</t> of her safety for the time being.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Manner</fen> denotes the manner of the certainty or uncertainty.</def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the mental state of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
<ex>She caught sight of her mother's <t>dubious</t> <fex name="Exr">expression</fex>.</ex>
Notice that we do NOT tag possessives such as 'her mother's' or 'on her face' that occur within the noun phrase of which the target adjective is a part. In sentences such as
<ex>She had a <t>dubious</t> <fex name="Exr">look</fex> on her face.</ex>
NOTE: We do NOT tag 'have' and its subject since the governor relationship is between the verb 'have' and the noun that the target adjective modifies rather than between the target adjective and the verb 'have'.</def-root>

FE.name: Concessive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason for which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: certain.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: completely convinced of something

lexUnit.name: uncertain.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not completely confident or sure

lexUnit.name: confident.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: feeling certainty about something

lexUnit.name: sure.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: completely confident that one is right

lexUnit.name: confidence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the feeling of certainty about something

lexUnit.name: convinced.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: very certain of something.

lexUnit.name: positive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: with no possibility of doubt; certain

lexUnit.name: dubious.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: hesitating or doubting

lexUnit.name: certainty.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the personal quality of being completely sure

lexUnit.name: doubt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel uncertain about.

lexUnit.name: doubtful.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: uncertain.

lexUnit.name: believe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel sure of the truth of.

lexUnit.name: uncertainty.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being not completely confident or sure

lexUnit.name: unsure.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: lacking confidence

lexUnit.name: doubt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: feeling of uncertainty or lack of conviction

lexUnit.name: trust.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: hold a belief

lexUnit.name: skeptical.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: reserving judgement as to the truth of.

lexUnit.name: skepticism.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a careful attitude of reserving judgement on the veractiy of.

lexUnit.name: skeptic.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person inclined to question or doubt accepted opinions.

lexUnit.name: know.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to hold a belief with confidence of its truth. Only in Certainty when there is contrastive stress on target; otherwise, belongs in Awareness.
